name: CPR with AED
description: CPR combined with Automated External Defibrillator
warning: Follow AED voice prompts carefully. Do not touch patient during shock delivery.
emergency_notes: AED will analyze heart rhythm automatically
Stand clear when shock is advised

steps.title: Survey the Scene
steps.description: Tap the shoulder of the patient and shout 'Are you okay?' to see if they are responding.
steps.voice_prompt: Survey the scene. Tap the patient's shoulder and shout, Are you okay?
steps.critical_warning: Check if patient is conscious, breathing, and has a pulse. Only perform CPR for patients who are unconscious, not breathing, and have no pulse.

steps.title: If Patient is Responsive
steps.description: If the person is responsive, has breathing, and has pulse, do not perform CPR. Call for an emergency. If the patient can walk, escort them to a safe area where they can rest.
steps.voice_prompt: If patient is responsive, do not perform CPR. Call emergency services and help them to a safe area.
steps.critical_warning: Do NOT perform CPR on a responsive patient with pulse and breathing

steps.title: Get Consent and Check Surroundings
steps.description: Get consent and ask witnesses what happened. Check your surroundings and make sure it is safe to perform CPR. Ask permission from anyone present during the accident.
steps.voice_prompt: Get consent from witnesses. Ask what happened and make sure the area is safe.
steps.critical_warning: Tip: Ask if there is someone related to the patient and ask them for consent. Also ask if the patient has a DNR (Do Not Resuscitate). If yes, you cannot perform CPR. Tip: Call the person out specifically, for example: The person in the red shirt, can I perform CPR?

steps.title: Turn On AED
steps.description: If an AED is present, turn the device on and follow the instructions in the AED.
steps.voice_prompt: Turn on the AED and follow its voice prompts.

steps.title: Prepare the Chest
steps.description: Remove all clothing covering the chest and wipe the chest dry.
steps.voice_prompt: Remove clothing from chest and wipe dry.

steps.title: Apply AED Pads
steps.description: Place one pad on the upper right side of the chest. Place the other pad on the lower left side of the chest.
steps.voice_prompt: Place one pad on upper right chest. Place other pad on lower left chest.
steps.critical_warning: Make sure pads are firmly attached to dry skin

steps.title: Let AED Analyze
steps.description: Wait for the AED to give you instructions. Do not touch the patient during analysis.
steps.voice_prompt: Wait for AED to analyze. Do not touch patient.

steps.title: Deliver Shock if Advised
steps.description: If the AED says you need to deliver a shock, make sure no one is touching the patient. Shout 'Clear' and push the 'shock' button on the AED to deliver the shock.
steps.voice_prompt: If shock advised, shout Clear and press the shock button.
steps.critical_warning: Make absolutely sure no one is touching the patient before delivering shock

steps.title: Resume CPR
steps.description: After the shock or if no shock is advised, immediately start with CPR. Make sure both your hands are locked on top of each other. Your shoulders should be directly over your hands and your elbows are locked.
steps.critical_warning: Minimize time between shock and resuming compressions

steps.title: Continue Until Help Arrives
steps.description: Continue CPR and follow AED instructions. Tap the shoulder of the patient and shout 'Are you okay?' to check if responsive. If responsive, stop CPR and wait for emergency services. If not responsive, continue CPR cycle.
steps.voice_prompt: Continue CPR and follow AED prompts until emergency services arrive.
steps.critical_warning: Wait for AED to give another analysis instruction every 2 minutes
